abstract: Chinese energy companies competing with multinational giants on their own turf, striking partnerships and joint ventures in the United States, Canada and Latin America.
snippet: Chinese energy companies competing with multinational giants on their own turf, striking partnerships and joint ventures in the United States, Canada and Latin America.
lead_paragraph: PetroChina agreed last month to buy a 50 percent stake in a Canadian gas venture for $5.4 billion. If the deal goes through, it will be the largest overseas acquisition on record for the Chinese oil company.

headline.main: China’s Energy Industry Pushes Into Developed Markets
